content.question: Based on your knowledge and the diagram, which of the following is true regarding the leadership structure of Congress?

choices.label: The role of the minority leader in both the House of Representatives and the Senate is to coordinate a strategy for the minority party.
The vice president is responsible for creating and setting the legislative agenda for the Senate.
The Speaker of the House has very little power to control members of the majority party in the House of Representatives.
The majority leaders in both chambers work to ensure that a bipartisan agenda is passed in the Congress.

content.answer: The role of the minority leader in both the House of Representatives and the Senate is to coordinate a strategy for the minority party.
